citation.article-title: Taxonomic studies on streptococci of serological groups C, G and L and possibly related taxa

p.s: Description of Streptococcus equi subsp. zooepidemicus nom. rev., comb. nov.
(zo. ö. e. pi. démi. cus. Gr. noun zoon an animal; Gr. adj. epidemius among people; prevalent, epidemic; M. L. adj. zooepidemicus prevalent among animals)
Gram-positive spherical or ovoid cells, occurring in pairs or chains.
Capsules may be formed.
On blood agar plates colonies are surrounded by a wide zone of β-haemolysis.
Catalase negative.
The optimum temperature for growth is ca. 37°C.
Growth does not occur at 10 or 45°C, in 6.5 % NaCl, in 10 % bile, in 0.1 % methylene blue milk, or at pH 9.6.
Cells do not survive heating at 60°C for 30 min.
Growth occurs only on complex media; minimal nutritional requirements are unknown.
Facultatively anaerobic.
Chemo-organotroph: metabolism fermentative Final pH in glucose broth ca. 4.6 to 5.0.
Acid produced from glucose, glycogen, lactose, ribose, salicin, sorbitol, sucrose and starch.
Acid not produced from arabinose, glycerol, inulin, mannitol, raffinose, trehalose or xylose.
Most strains hydrolyse aesculin.
Gelatin not liquefied; most strains do not hydrolyse hippurate.
Voges-Proskauer negative.
Alkaline phosphatase, arginine dehydrolase, β-glucuronidase and leucine arylamidase positive.
α-Galactosidase and pyrrolidonylarylamidase negative.
Most strains are β-galactosidase negative.
Reacts with Lancefield group C antisera.
The cell wall peptidoglycan is based upon lysine (type: Lys-Ala2-3).
Major non-hydroxylated long-chain fatty acids are hexadecanoic (C16:0) and octadecenoic (C18:1) acids; cyclopropane-ring containing fatty acids are absent.
Menaquinones are absent.
The guanine plus cytosine content of DNA ranges from 41.3 to 42.7 mol % as determined by melting temperature (Tm).
Source: blood stream, inflammatory exudates and lesions of diseased animals.
The type strain is NCDO 1358.
This strain is β-galactosidase negative and does not hydrolyse aesculin or hippurate.
Other characteristics are as given above.
The mol % G+C content of NCDO 1358 is 41.3 (Tm).
